last_episode_to_air.name: Bineshe Kwe
last_episode_to_air.overview: After much love and sorrow, the Little Bird family come together to mourn death and celebrate life.

name: Little Bird
overview: As part of a racist government policy now known as the Sixties Scoop, Bezhig Little Bird is removed from her home in Long Pine Reserve in Saskatchewan and adopted into a Montréal Jewish family at the age of five, becoming Esther Rosenblum. Now in her 20s, Bezhig longs for the family she lost and is willing to sacrifice everything to find them.

episodes.name: Love is all Around
episodes.overview: In 1968, Bezhig Little Bird and her siblings are removed from their home on the Long Pine Reserve and adopted into white families. Now in her 20s, Bezhig lives in Montreal as a Jewish woman named Esther Rosenblum, who seeks to uncover the truth of her past.

episodes.name: So Put Together
episodes.overview: Esther finds her adoption papers, and a newspaper clipping that evoke fuzzy memories of her young life on the Long Pine Reserve. Determined to learn more, she uproots her life and sacrifices everything in search of her family and identity.

episodes.name: The Land that Takes You
episodes.overview: Patti Little Bird is desperate to get her kids back, but she doesn’t know where they have been taken. Eighteen years later, Bezhig/Esther, who has made her way back to the prairies, is desperate to find her family, but both women are lost.

episodes.name: Burning Down the House
episodes.overview: Esther finds members of her family who help her put together the pieces of the past. She returns home to Montreal to confront Golda, her adoptive mother about the revelations she’s uncovered that shine a new light on their life and change the way they can look at the past.

episodes.name: I Want My Mom
episodes.overview: When tragedy strikes, Esther realizes that she needs her adoptive mother, Golda, more than anything.

episodes.name: Bineshe Kwe
episodes.overview: After much love and sorrow, the Little Bird family come together to mourn death and celebrate life.
